current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prohibit certain foreign assistance to the Government
		  of Egypt as a result of the July 3, 2013, military coup
		  d'état.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

header.#text:
Foreign
			 assistance restrictions in response to Egyptian military coup d'état

text.#text:
On June 30, 2012,
			 Mohamed Morsi was elected President of Egypt in elections that were certified
			 as free and fair by the Egyptian Presidential Election Commission and the
			 United Nations.

On July 3, 2013,
			 the military of Egypt removed the democratically elected President of Egypt,
			 arrested his supporters, and suspended the Constitution of Egypt. These actions
			 fit the definition of a military coup d'état.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
), the
			 United States is legally prohibited from providing foreign assistance to any
			 country whose duly elected head of government is deposed by a military coup
			 d'état, or removed in such a way that the military plays a decisive
			 role.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 7008 of the Department of State, Foreign Operations, and Related
			 Programs Act, 2012
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Department of State, Foreign Operations, and Related Programs Act, 2012/s:7008

text.#text:
The United States
			 has suspended aid to countries that have undergone military coups d'état in the
			 past, including the Ivory Coast, the Central African Republic, Thailand, Mali,
			 Fiji, and Honduras.

header.#text:
Foreign
			 assistance to the Government of Egypt

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall refrain from providing to
			 the Government of Egypt the assistance restricted under such section.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 7008 of the
			 Department of State, Foreign Operations, and Related Programs Act, 2012
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Department of State, Foreign Operations, and Related Programs Act, 2012/s:7008

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the following restrictions shall be in effect with respect to
			 United States assistance to the Government of Egypt:

text.#text: In addition to the restrictions referred to in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that democratic national elections have taken place in
			 Egypt followed by a peaceful transfer of power.

text.#text:
Deliveries of
			 defense articles currently slated for transfer to Egyptian Ministry of Defense
			 (MOD) and Ministry of Interior (MOI) shall be suspended until the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that democratic national elections have taken
			 place in Egypt followed by a peaceful transfer of power.

text.#text:
Provision of
			 defense services to Egyptian MOD and MOI shall be halted immediately until the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that democratic national elections have taken place in Egypt followed by a
			 peaceful transfer of power.

text.#text:
Processing of
			 draft Letters of Offer and Acceptance (LOAs) for future arms sales to Egyptian
			 MOD and MOI entities shall be halted until the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be borne by the Government of
			 Egypt.

text.#text:
All costs
			 associated with the delays in deliveries and provision of services required
			 under
